title.en: An Aspiration to Realize Madhyamaka, Mahāmudrā, and Mahā Ati

text.en: Samantabhadra, Vajradhara, and you, Mighty Sage, together with your close disciples
text.en-trans: tubwang nyesé kunzang dorjé chang

text.en: And oceanic deities of the Three Jewels, Three Roots, and dharmapālas—
text.en-trans: könchok tsa sum chösung gyatsö tsok

text.en: Incomparable Gurus in whom the three secrets of myriad siddhas are primordially perfected:
text.en-trans: tsungmé lama drubtob gyatso yi

text.en: Pray listen!
text.en-trans: sang sum döné dzok kün gong su sol

text.en: Having purified myself with the common and extraordinary preliminary practices:
text.en-trans: dé dang ngejung nyingjé sherab kyi

text.en: Cultivating faith, renunciation, compassion, and wisdom;
text.en-trans: chok sum kyab ten zhenpen samjor gyi

text.en: With reliance upon the refuge of the Three Jewels, and the altruistic wish to benefit others,
text.en-trans: tünmong tünmin khyepar ngöndro jong

text.en: May I enter the path pleasing to the victors!
text.en-trans: gyalwa gyepé lam la jukpar shok

text.en: The ultimate, essential nature of everything isemptiness,
text.en-trans: döndam chö kün neluk tongpanyi

text.en: And the obscuring nature,devoid of self-characteristics, can arise interdependently as anything whatsoever.
text.en-trans: kündzob tsenmé tenjung chir nang yang

text.en: Their union lies beyond all extremes and is the dhātubeyond aspiration—
text.en-trans: zungjuk tadral mönpa mepé ying

text.en: May I actualize the Middle Way view of the supreme vehicle!
text.en-trans: tek chok umé tawa ngöngyur shok

text.en: Through the threefold natural occurrence theco-emergenceof mind itself is realized;
text.en-trans: rangbab sum gyi semnyi lhenkyé tok

text.en: Experiencing the self-liberation of the four faults is thefourfold yoga.
text.en-trans: kyön zhi rangdrol nyamnyong naljor zhi

text.en: Having found the deep confidence that thefour kāyasare perfected within me,
text.en-trans: ku zhi rang la dzokpé deng nyé né

text.en: May I realize the meditation of Mahāmudrā!
text.en-trans: gompa chakgya chenpo tokpar shok

text.en: To realize the magical display of illusion, of appearance and mind as empty awareness,
text.en-trans: nang sem riktong gyumé chotrul la

text.en: Is to strike the vital point of the swift path of creation, recitation, method, and liberation;
text.en-trans: kyé dé tab drol nyurlam né du dek

text.en: To see saṃsāra and nirvāṇa arise as the dharmakāya is to take both happiness and suffering as the path.
text.en-trans: kyiduk lamkhyer khordé chökur shar

text.en: May I dispel obstacles and enhance the practice through the conduct ofsingle-taste!
text.en-trans: ronyom chöpé bokdön gek sel shok

text.en: Having liberated preoccupation with thought and hankering after self-characteristics into theprimordially puredhātu,
text.en-trans: yichö tsen dzin kadak ying su drol

text.en: Thefour visions of spontaneous presenceexhaust contamination whence it lies.
text.en-trans: lhündrub nang zhi zakpa rang sar zé

text.en: May I win the citadel of the dharmadhātu, theyouthful kāya within a vase,
text.en-trans: chöying zhönnu bumkur tensi zin

text.en: And achieve the four visions of the resultantGreat Perfection!
text.en-trans: drebu dzogchen nang zhi ngöngyur shok

text.en: With swift compassion for all beings throughout space,
text.en-trans: khakhyab dro kün jedzin tukjé nyur

text.en: And to obtain the potential, ability, methods, and knowledge to tame those difficult ones —
text.en-trans: dul ka dul la tabkhé nü tob tsen

text.en: Bringing about the amazing twofold spontaneous benefit —
text.en-trans: dön nyi lhündrub mejung drubtob ché

text.en: May I emulate the awe-inspiring siddhas of the past!
text.en-trans: namtar jizhin dak gi ngöngyur shok
